text:
In order to support low income access to healthy, local produce by low-income San Franciscans, as well as to provide additional markets for regional farmers, the Agriculture Commissioner shall conduct a needs assessment of neighborhoods in San Francisco that could support additional farmers markets without impacting the viability of locally owned businesses. This needs assessment shall primarily focus on identifying the best location for farmers' markets in underserved neighborhoods. This needs assessment shall be submitted to the Clerk of Board of Supervisors on an annual basis. 
(Added by Ord. 29-07, File No. 061112, App. 2/16/2007)
